item.title: P.G. add a quote by Laurence Sterne
item.description: "Digressions incontestably are the sunshine; they are the life, the soul of reading." -- Laurence Sterne

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Joan Crawford
item.description: "Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your hearth or burn down your house, you can never tell." -- Joan Crawford

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Matt Groening
item.description: "Love is a snowmobile racing across the tundra and then suddenly it flips over, pinning you underneath. At night, the ice weasels come." -- Matt Groening

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Jeffrey McDaniel
item.description: "Even when I'm dead, I'll swim through the Earth, like a mermaid of the soil, just to be next to your bones." -- Jeffrey McDaniel

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "Where there is great love, there are always miracles." -- Willa Cather

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "I have made a lot of mistakes falling in love, and regretted most of them, but never the potatoes that went with them." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "I believe it was Shakespeare, or possibly Howard Cosell, who first observed that marriage is very much like a birthday candle, in that 'the flames of passion burn brightest when the wick of intimacy is first ignited by the disposable butane lighter of physical attraction, but sooner or later the heat of familiarity causes the wax of boredom to drip all over the vanilla frosting of novelty and the shredded coconut of romance.' I could not have phrased it better myself." -- Dave Barry

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "And there was that poor sucker Flaubert rolling around on his floor for three days looking for the right word." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Bruce Springsteen
item.description: "Someday we'll look back on this and it will all seem funny." -- Bruce Springsteen

item.title: P.G. add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: P.G. add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook." -- Julia Child
